title: FinLLM - Large Language Model for Financial Analytics

problem.description: Adaptation of open-source Large Language Models for specific financial applications: market sentiment analysis, risk assessment, structured report generation. General-purpose LLMs lack deep understanding of financial language and market dynamics.
painPoints: Generic LLMs don't correctly interpret financial terminology
Need for real-time sentiment scoring from financial news
Report generation requires specific structure and compliance
Complex integration with trading agents and risk dashboards

technical: Inference latency < 2s for real-time use cases
Integration with existing systems (C++ trading engines)
compliance: Data privacy on sensitive financial documents

solution.architecture: Domain adaptation pipeline: fine-tuning open-source LLM (Hugging Face Transformers) on financial corpora → semantic document embedding for search → real-time sentiment scoring API → integration with trading agents via REST. Docker deployment with PyTorch backend.
keyDecisions: FinBERT as pre-trained starting point on financial corpus
LoRA fine-tuning for GPU memory efficiency
Vector database (Qdrant/Pinecone) for document semantic search
A/B testing sentiment scores vs human expert annotations
solution.approach: Iterative workflow: 1) Financial news + reports data collection, 2) Text preprocessing and cleaning, 3) Incremental LLM fine-tuning with validation set, 4) Evaluation on financial benchmarks (FiQA, FinQA), 5) Integration testing with trading dashboards, 6) Production deployment with hallucination monitoring.

metrics.label: Sentiment accuracy
metrics.description: Fine-tuned FinBERT on financial news dataset (10k samples)

metrics.label: Inference latency
metrics.description: Real-time scoring for news feed integration

results.impact: Finance-tailored LLM provides strategic insights: real-time market sentiment influences trading agents, document semantic search accelerates analyst research, automated report generation saves time (estimated 20h/week per team). Competitive edge in algo trading strategies.
